result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel L Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation agent to request a probation review hearing about 4 months after defendant is done serving his jail sentence.  Conditions of probation apply to both counts.
Concurrent with: 15-CF-24, 15-CF-68, 15-CF-147

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   Cash bond applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. (Costs have been paid in full)
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Transcript - Sentencing Hearing on Revocation 3-22-2018

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 4. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 4. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Atty Meier asks court to revoke bond in all files. State doesn't feel that is necessary as defendant is being held awaiting sentencing after revocation in 14-CF-72.  Court leaves bonds as previously set in all files. Sentencing set for 3/10/16 at 8:15 am.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Discussion regarding representation in new file. Defendant feels he may now qualify for PD. Court won't appoint an atty if defendant qualifies for PD representation. Atty Meier indicates he doesn't take PD appointments, advises he is not currently representing defendant in 15-CF-147 but would like to resolve all matters together along with revocation case.  Atty Meier would like to see discovery on new file, has a few questions of the State before proceeding. Court appoints Atty Meier in 15-CF-147 only, sets plea hearing for 12/30/15. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Defense waives reading of Information and stands mute to all charges. Court enters not guilty pleas on defendants behalf.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
